reviews.review: I noticed that the graphics got very improved from the first game. Humans look more realistic and natural with better voice acting. And the water looks like actual water now. And the story is kind of different from the first one, too, in an intriguing way. I can see why people demand a sequel to this game. I demand Half-Life 3 as well. Btw, I really hated Striders in Follow Freeman. Even with Easy mode, it's da*n frustrating to get through. Whoever designed that part should've gotten fired already.
Best game of all history, i only wish to play Half-Life 3 before i die

MacBook (13-inch, Aluminum, Late 2008)
Processor 2 GHz Intel Core 2 Duo
Memory   2 GB 1067 MHz DDR3
Graphics  NVIDIA GeForce 9400M 256 MB

Flawless AI, exciting action, an original story, terrifying creatures, glitchless, memorable characters, great voice acting, amazing sound, immersive environments, nail-biting tension, and effective horror. Are the graphics starting to show their age a bit? Yes, but it‚Äôs not distracting.

It's my second favorite game of all time and it deserves to be called a classic.

I give this masterpiece a well-deserved 10/10!!!!

It's a cult classic for a reason, the graphics are pretty good, even by today's standards. The story is captivating, engaging, and thrilling.
The gameplay is easy to learn, but it's still a difficult game. It features semi-difficult puzzles.
The graphics settings can be tweaked to your hearts content, something you can expect of Valve. If you've got a bad computer, then most likely you can play the game and get 60 fps, and in most cases get medium to high.
It dosen't feature any player choice, or any 'impactful' side quests that'd effect the game world.
I wonder what will happen in the next one...

Half Life 1 was a purely Science Fiction story that drew all of its inspiration from the Sciences.  And that's what we all loved so much, the purely atheistic scientific adventure - because the Sciences are purely atheistic and hence neutral.  Half Life 1 focused on our primal biological instinct to survive - survival of the strongest species.  But "strongest" does not necessarily mean brute strength.  In Nature, any trick that works to do the job is good enough.  We have such developed brains for a good reason..  And that's what captivated us all in HL1: the primal biological instinct of survival that utilizes empirical research and the Sciences and our brains to use them to our advantage.  Unfortunately, the scientific ideology and inspiration of Half Life has been degraded and polluted.  The momentary religious propaganda in the game was very distasteful.  It clearly feels like the world of Half Life is quickly becoming a political and religious propaganda machine, instead of continuing the neutral scientific story to open up players' minds to science and fundamental real life as it is, to Nature, Biology and the Sciences - which are the true and only foundations of our reality.

I sincerely hope that future sequels will stay away from the filth of religion and politics, and will really pick up where HL1 left of, solely concentrate on pure biological survival and technology.

On the technical side, the game - and the two episodes - runs fine on my laptop with integrated graphics and Windows 10.  But the additional episodes - Episode One and Two, have a much higher demand on system resources, so if you have a low spec system and want to play at high res widescreen with moderate effects or higher, than this (Half Life 2) is the game for you - but I bought the Orange Box and got HL1 + extras up to HL2 and Episodes, and am glad I did, because I play HL1 and Blue Shift on my Android tablet with Xash3D (I just need the game data files from these purchases) and I finally got to know how things went on after HL1 - though I'm not happy with the moral content, as I wrote above.  But technically the game is very nice, great graphics and effects, much better and refreshing physics and game mechanics did not disappoint!!

Definitely worth getting and playing though, just keep a emotional distance when playing - don't let the cleverly sewn in propaganda get you, aimed primarily at lonely guys who are attached to their equipment more than to others and other things in life, and spend most of their time in a virtual fantasy cyberspace - which is really great and I love it as well, but be careful what is being fed to your intellect and subconsciousness.  Same with movies and all other content.

Uno de los mejores videojuegos de la historia y la mejor secuela de un videojuego que jamas haya existido. Este juego mejoro en todos los aspectos a su antecesor. Una historia mucho mas profunda, personajes mas memorables y cre√≠bles, un motor de f√≠sicas exquisito que sirve para muchos puzzles en el juego, un entorno muy hermoso y cre√≠ble, gracias sobre todo a diversos scripts que hacen que todo lo que nos rodea se vea muy real. Se me hace dif√≠cil describir un juego tan magnifico como este, por eso creo que todo ser humano debe probar este videojuego antes de morirse. 
Esta es una saga incre√≠ble, que tristemente y a dia de hoy, aun no sale su tan ansiada tercera parte, casi dos a d√©cadas despu√©s de la publicaci√≥n de este juego.
Sigo estando fascinado por el amor que Valve le meti√≥ a esta saga, y es una pena no ver a mas desarrolladoras AAA como esta.
10/10: "Uno de los mejores videojuegos de la historia."
